statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description:
It didn't take long for New Jersey
Nets forward Richard Jefferson to recover from one of the biggest
blunders of his career.
article.headline: Jefferson makes up for blunder with 22 points

images.name: Jefferson_Richard 021203 inline
images.caption: New Jersey's Richard Jefferson fakes out Atlanta's Jason Terry on his way to 22 points and 14 rebounds.

article.linkText: Jefferson bounces back to lead injured Nets past Hawks
article.story:
EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) -- It didn't take long for New Jersey Nets forward Richard Jefferson to recover from one of the biggest blunders of his career. Less than 48 hours after giving away a game in Seattle, Jefferson bounced back with 22 points and a career-high 14 rebounds Tuesday night to lead the banged-up Nets to an 87-72 victory over the Atlanta Hawks. The victory was soured minutes after the game when the Nets learned that eight-time All-Star center Dikembe Mutombo will be sidelined for about two months after having surgery Thursday on his right wrist to repair a torn ligament. ''We talked about that,'' said new starting center Jason Collins, who had eight points and 10 rebounds. ''It's going to take a team effort. We have to be strong and supportive of him through his injury. We know he'll definitely be missed out there.'' The Nets didn't have any trouble against the Hawks with Jefferson making amends for his mistake Sunday night when he missed two free throws with New Jersey up by two points with 9.8 seconds left. Brent Barry then hit a game-winning 3-pointer for Seattle. ''I'm a very confident individual,'' said Jefferson, who was 9-for-12 against Atlanta and 4-for-6 from the free-throw line. ''I really blame that loss completely on myself. It was hard at the time. But you can't let that set in. You continue working and come out the next game.'' Nets coach Byron Scott said he wasn't worried about Jefferson. ''The thing about Richard is he'll come back stronger the next game,'' Scott said. ''That has been his M.O. since he got here.'' Kenyon Martin added 18 points and Rodney Rogers had 12 on a night the Nets also were without guard Kerry Kittles (knee). Even an off night by Jason Kidd (seven points, six assists, four rebounds) didn't hurt as New Jersey used its tough defense to hold Atlanta to season-lows in points, field goals (29) and shooting percentage (.363). The Hawks' previous lows were 88 points, 30 field goals and 39.1 percent. ''We never got anything going,'' Hawks coach Lon Kruger said. Atlanta's potent frontcourt of Glenn Robinson (22.4 points) and Shareef Abdur-Rahim (21.6) combined for just 19 points on 8-for-26 shooting. ''We have some soul searching we have to do and see what we want to do,'' Abdur-Rahim said. ''It was a bad one, pretty much all the way around for us.'' Reserve guard Dion Glover has 16 points to lead the Hawks, who lost their fourth consecutive road game and fifth in seven games overall. New Jersey won this game with strong finishes at the end of the first and second quarters. Leading 17-16, Kidd hit a driving layup and a 3-pointer to cap a 10-2 spurt that gave New Jersey a 27-18 lead. Jefferson provided the fireworks in a 10-point run at the end of the second quarter. The second-year forward hit two free throws and a jumper to ignite the burst and capped it by running the baseline to jam an alley-oop pass from Kidd with less than a second left for a 51-35 lead. The game got ugly after that. By the end of the game, Nets fans were chanting ''Scal-a-brine,'' their plea to Scott to insert 12th man Brian Scalabrine. Scott obliged with 1:44 remaining to the roar of the crowd. Game notes
Kittles was placed on the injured list on Tuesday and guard Brandon Armstrong was activated. ... The Hawks had six baskets in the third quarter and no assists. ... The Nets also beat the Hawks in the season opener, 105-94. ... Hawks center Theo Ratliff had eight rebounds, giving him 2,500 for his career.
